result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven T. Delap was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $334 payable to JESO (payment of Alexander Schmidt's bills)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fees

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#14JE298 (dov: 2/5/14) - bailjumping and bars it from prosecution

--Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Programming or other Intervention programming, per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--No Contact with Alexander Schmidt 
--No Contact with Jessica Torrisi unless she and Agent consent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

05-22-2014 The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect that the defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program/Earned Release Program

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Delap to 56 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 20 months and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 36 months. This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 199 days credit for time already served.  The Court clarifies that this credit is for the dates of 9/6/15 to today's date, minus 34 days which is the length of incarceration Mr. Delap served in Dodge County, with good time, on the Dodge County 45 day Jail term. The Court allows sixty days for either party to file any request related to sentence credit.




*****PER 10-06-2016 ORDER JOC is amended to reflect 0 credit*******
Consecutive to:

superMiscConds.notes:
--to complete a Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Program, or similar domestic violence treatment program, as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as required by the Agent

--No acts or threats of violence 
--No Contact with Alexander Schmidt
--To pay the balance due on restitution of $306.76, this amount is due to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office
--To pay court costs and surcharges;  any amount that had previously been paid on court costs is to be credited

Case called at 10:32am [ma]
Defendant Steven T. Delap appears via videoconferencing from Green Bay Corr., in custody.
His Counsel,  Attorney Michael J. Herbert appears via telephone.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On agreement of all parties, the Court finds that video conferencing is sight and sound sufficient

On Motion to Withdraw as Appelate Counsel:
--Atty. Herbert indicates that the motion has NOT been withdrawn; further that Mr. Delap is intending on proceeding pro se.
--Mr. Delap indicates that he approves Atty. Herbert withdrawing

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
The Court finds Mr. Delap competent to represent himself; finds that he is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to counsel

The Court grants Atty. Herbert's motion to withdraw; Atty. Herbert disconnects at 10:38am

On Sentence Credit:
--Mr. Delap indicates that after conducting additional research he is no longer pursuing the sentence credit issue

The Court orders that the credit remain as previously ordered; which is 0 days on this date.

Mr. Delap makes inquires of the Court as to sentence credit on case 12CF423
--The Court orders Mr. Delap to submit letter/motion by end of April 2017 on this topic

Mr. Delap inquires the Court about a possible sentence modification, due to new factors, being according to Mr. Delap sentence credit 
--the Court indicates that the sentence credit issue has already been addressed by DOC, and it is not a new issue

[MK] case called at 9:29am. 
Defendant Steven T. Delap in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. [ADA Brookellen Teuber substitutes, to appear for the State, at 9:36am.]
Attorney Dahnert indicates that Mr. Delap would like to enter a plea and proceed to sentencing today, however Mr. Delap wishes to argue his own case.  At the request of Mr. Delap, she has filed a stipulation that she withdraw as counsel.
Mr. Delap makes a statement regarding his desire to proceed to sentencing without counsel. 
The Court reviews right to counsel.    
Maximum penalties recited; elements reviewed; Constitutional rights reviewed.
The Court accepts Mr. Delap's waiver of counsel. The Court finds that Mr. Delap is competent to represent himself. 
Attorney Dahnert is excused and she exits the hearing at 9:45am.
Mr. Delap enters a Plea of " No Contest " to Count #1; factual basis stipulated including as to the Repeater status; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Delap guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #2.


On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Delap to 56 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 20 months and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 36 months. This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 199 days credit for time already served.  The Court clarifies that this credit is for the dates of 9/6/15 to today's date, minus 34 days which is the length of incarceration Mr. Delap served in Dodge County, with good time, on the Dodge County 45 day Jail term. The Court allows sixty days for either party to file any request related to sentence credit.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to complete a Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Program, or similar domestic violence treatment program, as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as required by the Agent
--No acts or threats of violence 
--No Contact with Alexander Schmidt 
--To pay the balance due on restitution of $306.76, this amount is due to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office  
--To pay court costs and surcharges;  any amount that had previously been paid on court costs is to be credited
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:43am.
to Withdrawl as Counsel - Attorney Sylvie Dahnert
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from John C Burke Correctional on 4/26/16 for proceedings in Branch 4
Scheduling order
Jury trial at 05-02-2016 08:30 am
Final status/scheduling conference at 04-26-2016 09:00 am
Attorney Dahnert

Case called at 2:11 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for plea hearing)
Defendant Steven T. Delap in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jessica A Klein. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Klein submits motion to withdraw; Atty Klein expands on motion upon request of Court
Court discusses age of case, concerns of changing lawyers causing delay
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Klein indicates that she would be willing to represent Mr. Delap at trial
Mr. Delap discusses video evidence, intent and alleged evidence and indicates that he would like a different lawyers opinion on whether
or not he should proceed to trial or enter a plea
Court present basis and grants Atty Klein's motion to withdraw and sets matter for trial
Court directs Atty Klein to contact SPD and inform them that she has been withdrawn from case
Mr. Delap informs the Court that he has a reconfinement hearing on the 18th and will likely be moved to Dodge County
Court informs Mr. Delap to inform counsel if he is moved
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Delap indicated that if he goes to trial, he will have street clothes
Atty Klein informs the Court that some deputies have volunteered to write letters on behalf of Mr. Delap on his positive changes within the jail, but were told they can not
Court presents basis and informs Atty Klein that It can not order them to write letters, but there are ways that they can appear at sentencing
Recess: 2:33 pm

Case called at 1:27pm [mo]
Defendant Steven T. Delap appears via videoconferencing from Green Bay Correctional, in custody. His Attorney, Thomas Brady Aquino appears in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court questions Attorney Aquino about his counsel status
Attorney Aquino indicates that he will not be Trial counsel, he was only appointed for Post Conviction matters. 
The Court inquires of Mr. Delap his intentions of obtaining a new Public Defender for purposes of Trial.
Mr. Delap informs the Court that he did mail the Jefferson Public Defender the application and financial information.
The Court directs the Clerk to phone the Jefferson SPD office and gain insight of receipt of Mr. Delap's information.
The Jefferson SPD office indicates that it has not received the information.
Mr. Delap indicates that he does not wish to proceed to trial but does want a fair resolution.
The Court directs the Clerk to phone the Jefferson SPD office post hearing and request a new application be sent to Mr. Delap.
The Court suggests that Mr. Delap may need additional time to obtain counsel.
No objection from either party.
Mr. Delap requests atleast 5 weeks to obtain counsel.
No objection from either party

Atty. Aquino requests to be removed as counsel on Mr. Delap's case.
The Court approves Attorney Aquino's request to be removed as counsel

recess: 1:37pm

Cases 13CM456, 14CF60 & 14CM70 called together 11:36 am 
Defendant Steven T. Delap in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Theresa Ann Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews plea paperwork, including criminal case settlement with Mr. Delap
off-record: 11:46 - 11:47 am for Atty Huebner to complete waiver of preliminary hearing paperword

14CF60: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Delap waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information: Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CF60 & Count #2-13CM456; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CF60, Count #1-13CM456 & Case 14CM70
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses uncharged referral DA Case#14JE298 (dov: 2/5/14) - bailjumping and bars it from prosecution

On Count #1-14CF60, the Court sentences Mr. Delap to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Programming or other Intervention programming, per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence to any person
--No Contact with Alexander Schmidt 
--No Contact with Jessica Torrisi unless she and Agent consent
--To pay restitution of $334 payable to JESO (payment of Alexander Schmidt's bills)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fees
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

On Count #2-13CM456, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, to be served in the prison system; to commence consecutive to 14CF60
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443 + $100 domestic abuse sucharge = $543; to be converted to civil judgment
Recess: 12:20 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Attorney Karl Huebner
Status conference on March 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

cases #14CF60 & #14CM70 called at 1:44pm. 
Defendant Steven T. Delap appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Delap. The Court indicates that it recognizes Mr. Delap's name but does not recall Mr. Delap or recognize him.  The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaints in each case is admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
In Case #14CF60: Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
In Case #14CM70: Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

The Court requires a $1,500 signature bond [applies to both cases], with conditions:
--no contact with Andrew Schmidt 
--no contact with Jessica Torrisi
--no acts or threats of violence
recess 1:57pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/12/14 at 2:00pm  (2) Status Conference on 3/28/14 at 9:30am (JA- please note in comments that case #14CF60 is at Prelimnary Hearing stage)--- Mr. Delap remains in the JCJ awaiting revocation proceedings
